intro: Helipterum involucratum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Helipterum involucratum is often used in dried floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms.
